member.name: T:Microsoft.Dynamics.Retail.PaymentSDK.ISessionOperation
member.summary: Generic session operations. Sessions have a beginning and an ending. A single operation should only be invoked sequentially. The host application must call BeginOperation and EndOperation in pairs. Only if BeginOperation fails should EndOperation not be invoked. Once a session is started the SessionStatus event will indicate when it is ready and the EndOperation can be invoked. If the EndOperation is invoked before that time it will either block until ready or cancel the operation. The result of the EndOperation depends upon the type of operation being performed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Retail.PaymentSDK.ISessionOperation.HasCapability(System.String)
member.summary: Is the operation specified by the token supported.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Retail.PaymentSDK.ISessionOperation.BeginOperation(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Begin the operation specified the token. If this returns true then the caller must invoke EndSession before the next attempt to perform this operation. EndOperation should not be called if this returns false.
member.remarks: If this method returns true, caller must invoke EndOperation() when done; otherwise, they should not call EndOperation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Dynamics.Retail.PaymentSDK.ISessionOperation.EndOperation(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: End the operation specified by the token and get the results.
member.returns: The value returned depends upon the operation performed.
